title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process seeks to identify your core personality and what you can do to promote or support an existing positive culture. A very positive work environment with everyone always willing to help.
Interview Questions: What are your values and what drives you as an individual.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Program Coordinator, then did a mock teaching session with the Dean, the program coordinator, and someone from the admin team, for a realistic approach to their classroom dynamics.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a student who is frustrated that they are not understanding the course content?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The questions were easy to anwser and decently standard. They asked questions about leading a team and questions about adult based learning. The interview process wasn't trying to trick you and I felt as if they really asked questions related to the job. The interviewer, was very kind as well and it was an overwhelmingly positive experience.
Interview Questions: How do you lead a team with diversity in mind.

title: Planning Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1. Telephonic interview with HR 
Round 2. Zoom interview with director (Project mangement Office) and program manager (Stratergic alignment and Business analytics and
After 1 week, I received an offer letter from centennial college
Interview Questions: Q. Tell me about yourself

title: ELearning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was highly structured much like a union job interview, where the interviewers needed to take notes and fill out boxes based on my answers. There was no room for flow or building rapport in the conversation. It was very unnatural and I left disappointed with the interaction.  I didn't feel it was a good fit (and I imagine they agreed).
Interview Questions: They asked about past experience and my approach - it seemed they were looking for key words to check off in the boxes on their sheets.

title: Business Process Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview after applying through a recruiter. After the initial interview, they contacted me two days later for a second interview. Overall was a good interview, however they decided to rescind the role
Interview Questions: Say I handed you a document in current state process map, what would you look for to indicate that process improvements could be made. What characteristics would you be looking for that could indicate there could be process improvement capabilities?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held through zoom video.  I was able to share my screen through zoom with them. The whole process was very relaxing  and smooth. The interviewer was really nice. I had a nice talk with them.
Interview Questions: Describe your past work experience

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straight forward. Needed to hit various targets. Met with a panel as part of the team. Questions varied from past history to new ideas about the current state analysis. Asked if I was comfortable working autonomously and from home for the duration of the contract.
Interview Questions: Do you have familiarity with AODA

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: Started with a email to confirm my time. They were thoughtful questions related to the job. They were very friendly and understanding. They also put questions in the chatbox so you can read them again.
Interview Questions: Walk us through your resume

title: Accessibility Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
For this interview, it's just mostly asking questions about why you would apply for this position. Then we begin speaking about Xbox and its accessibilities criteria and comparing it to other consoles like PS.  
Then, they let me know after 3-4 days that they would like to hire me.
Interview Questions: 1. Why should we hire you?

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Centennial College (Scarborough, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took 15 minutes. They ask general interview questions but they ask many technical questions. Study up on basic IT skills before you enter. You have the opportunity to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Examples include the difference between ipconfig and ifconfig, what happens when you type in google.com, the benefits of subnetting, difference between IPv4 vs IPv6, etc.

title: Childcare Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: A few questions that ask you to describe situations that were ______ happened and how you handled it. The interviewer was very nice and quite relaxed. Take you time to think of good answers
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge you encountered working with a diverse community and how you overcame that

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Centennial College in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty quick and easy. just make sure to apply on time and be confident at the interview. Networking is best and very helpful. So, network as much as possible, have clarity and confidence and stay positive.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Why you are interested to work at Centennial?
What value will you add as a student ambassador?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It went really great and i had a fantastic feeling with interviewers. My interview was online and i had a problem with my mic and they were really patient till i could connect. It was panel interview.
Interview Questions: It was more about understanding if I'm able to work easily in the team and checking my work culture.

title: Electronics Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: was brief from the start, based on skills and requirements for the job, nothing too technical. Was a comfortable process, just 3 people questioning the knowledge I've claimed to know and a fit for the job.
Interview Questions: About my problem solving experiences

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was pretty much simple, initially I was scared but the process didn’t take much time. It was 20mins interview but with 5 selected students. 

1. Filled form 
2. They selected and took interviews: and asked questions related to campus scenarios
3. Sent an email to confirm my position
Interview Questions:
How you think, you can support students with? 
How you think, you are different from other candidates? 
What if you need to support students internationally who are studying out of country .

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: mock interviews helped us to prepare well. this was a good opportunity for us to prepare as well as be confidant for the work environment. this was an opportunity to communicate to the work environment as well
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: First a phone screening than an in-panel interview . The in person panel was a little more difficult. They sent a significant case study which required hours or prep that I needed to present for a part time contract position
Interview Questions: First a phone screening than an in-panel interview . The in person panel was a little more difficult. They sent a significant case study which required hours or prep that I needed to present for a part time contract position

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College (Scarborough, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First a phone screening than an in-panel interview . The  in person panel was a little more difficult. They sent a significant case study which required hours or prep that I needed to present for a part time contract position
Interview Questions: What i could bring to the role

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straightforward  interview as there was flow with reference  to your resume. It took about two weeks to hear back. A less tense atmosphere and great people
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and experience

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview. They asked what do you know about u and our projects. Very detail oriented interviewer. Also they are technical people which is good.  Then I also asked them some job specific  questions which they happily answered
Interview Questions: What are you strengths

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was easy . I aswered almost all questions. Some technical and some behaviroul questios. study for behaviroul questions pricisely and be prepared.so best of luck for your interview.  review your technical skills.
Interview Questions: what are different moniterong softeares

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: it is the interview directly with the clients of the college, so the interview process will be based on which client you work with. Thus, it is based on your luck to find suitable project for you.
Interview Questions: Some questions about database. But the questions will be based on your client

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a one to one interview. The interview took 20 mins and there was a 5 mins where I have to give a lesson of given topic. After the interview, you are given a test to solve within an hour.
Interview Questions: If a student is having trouble with a question, how would you help that student?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Difficult  interview process  i had 4 interviews to complete and the interview process was very lengthy  and  the questions were complicated to answer at times and i had to go through several testings in each interview.
Interview Questions: Why do i feel i would bring value to the college?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: its 1 on 1 interview with senior learning technician. they explain you the role and you need to get reference from the teachers. the reference is important for the supervisor to review the material and knowledge.
Interview Questions: Explain all the material

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: i just went to the web site. they asked me the questions that people always ask. then they called me again ro another interview and they helped me with the transportation.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a 3 person panel interview with a 10 minute teaching demo, timed and stopped at the 10min mark. Was required to prepare a 3 hour lesson plan. Second round interview was with the Dean of the school and the Department Chair.
Interview Questions: Describe a student evaluation that you believe was successful, describe a student evaluation that you do not think was successful. Provide specific examples

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Centennial College in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were in total 2 rounds for the position. The interview process started with phone interview which involved screening then face to face interview afterwhich the offer letter was made.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very smooth and with comfortable questions. Behavioral questions and situational questions were included. A C# related question was given to reply that how will I explain the question to student so that student understands it quick.
Interview Questions: How will you explain the the Given solution to the student?

title: International Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Two steps between two weeks.
Questions: Tell me about yourself
Weakness
Why do you want to work here
What do you do for leisure
Where do you live (near or far)
How long is your VISA
COmputer skills
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Weakness
Why do you want to work here

title: Due Process Issues and Breach of Natural Law Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: They allow anonymous written complaints to be used against people to deny an interview. There is no ADR process and they prefer a climate of fear and competition over collegiality
Interview Questions: no questions no interview although I had been offered the job previously

title: School College Work Initiative Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initially a phone screening was conducted to verify information on my resume and to ask questions regarding my experience managing finances. An interview was then conducted with a panel of 5 people including one HR representative, A second interview was conducted with the new direct manager.
Interview Questions: How would you increase retention in the program among students?

title: Co-op Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed via skype which took around 15 min.
I had a few common tutor questions.
They emphasized they have more international students and cultural diversity, but
I think it's typical in College around Toronto.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student doesn't understand what you taught?

title: Alumni Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: First step was the Phone interview and after 1 week they called to confirm face to face panel interview. Phone interview is about 30 minutes long with checking and verifying information on the resume.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Centennial College (Scarborough, ON) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview had questions which stated issues that may be faced at the job and required to be answered to the supervisor's satisfaction. There was one long interview where various case-studies were presented.
Interview Questions: How will you deal with a student who is either insecure or has some disability?

title: Accounting and Business Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the college website, and it was a full time coop position. The process took around 1+ week. I got an interview at Centennial College Progress Campus and 3 hiring manager interview me. Very nice and friendly, the questions are very easy.
Interview Questions:
1. Have you done any tutoring before?
2. How would you handle a student with disabiliy?
3. What would you do if the student doesn't fully comprehen english. ( recommend them to the ESL center )
4.Any experience working or being in a diverse enviroment ?
And they give you some cases and ask what would you do in that situation.

title: Peer Tutor (Nursing) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: In person interview is taken by college authority. After final selection a training was arranged by the employer. They have asked my academic performance and hands on experience and skill.
Interview Questions: They have asked my academic performance and hands on experience and skill.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Centennial College (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: some common questions. start with introducing yourself and then they ask a lot of behavioral questions, and they make everything straightforward. How to respect your students? how to deal with difference in culture? and how to deal with student who has depressions?
Interview Questions: If you have a student come late all the time, what are you going to do with this?

title: Curriculum Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centennial College (Scarborough, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 telephone interview approximately 10 minutes. A week later I had a face-to-face interview with three managers. The interview lasted approximately 40 minutes. One week later I received word that I got the position.
Interview Questions: How has your educational background and prior experiences prepared you for success in this role?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, panel-led and has a mix of teaching demo as well as overall interview discussing background, experience and qualifications. The interview process started with a 10min teaching demo where i was asked to present a subject as if i was presenting it to students in the classroom (brief sent 2 weeks earlier to prepare). The most important aspect of a teaching demo, is to demonstrate (1) knowledge of subject matter and (2) presenting the material in an engaging manner, again as if presenting to students and not a professional audience. After the demo, we had a 5min Q&A about the demo and we then moved to a 40min interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle classroom conflict?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Mock tutoring session with any topic. Many communication and facilitating skills applied. Focus more on student instead of teaching-centered. Recruitment process is very transparent. The information is always up-to-date. The follow-up is very prompt.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the most important as a Peer Tutor?

title: Accounting and Business Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with a panel of potential supervisors and answered questions regarding how to tutor different kinds of students as well as personality and previous experiences. It's best when you have previous teaching experience as it gives you a better understanding of how to respond to the needs of students. The interview was interesting to me and the staff were very friendly but its difficulty depends on whether you understand teaching.
Interview Questions: Imagine a student comes up to you after having not done any of their course assignments or attended any lectures. How will you go about tutoring that student?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 part interview process.  Part one was with the coordinator.  That was casual with the review of my CV as well as questions.   The second part was with the department Dean which consisted of a teaching demo for which I had to field questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a face to face interview, in a very friendly environment. There were calculation questions about molarity and dilutions. It was a short and simple interview. It took approximately 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why are you here?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Centennial College
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted near the end of the semester. Found out alter it was because the managers wanted to allow students to have an opportunity to find jobs outside of the school.
Interview Questions: What is TTL?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: To apply for this job you must be a full time student at Centennial College. Then you apply online with the list of classes that you might tutor. The trick is that you must apply to many courses so they get interested on you and they call you for person interview.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience teaching other people and why I wanted to be a tutor.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Centennial College (Scarborough, ON) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through their website. I applied in October and had my first phone interview in early December. I was invited for an interview in January and given an offer in February. I started on March 1st.

Phone interview with HR. Panel interview with HR and Managers. Reference review. Hired. 

If they tell you they are contacting your references, 99% certain you have the job.
Interview Questions:
Lots of situational and behavioural questions. Each interviewer goes around and asks a question from a form. On the form, you are judged on a scale of 1-5 on how well you answered. You must hit on each of the points they have listed in order to score high. At the end of the interview, scores are added up from each person and the person with the highest number usually gets the role. 

I was also asked to prepare a presentation.

title: Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and was interviewed over the phone by the HR rep.  Phone interview revolved around questions pertaining to resume and a few simple behavioural questions. 

Panel Interview was conducted by the same HR rep, hiring manager and the director of the division.  Each person asked one question and went through the list of questions.

Questions: Were simple behavioural questions as well as other questions asking for examples of projects worked on.

Overall Impression: Negative, the HR rep asked some very disrespectful questions and talked negatively about my qualifications only to be rebuffed by the hiring manager and director who backed me up.  It was a very awkward situation.  In the end, I recieved an email from the HR advising me that the position had been filled by another candidate.  This position has since been readvertised many times.  It's my impression that the HR rep is out of touch with the requirements of the job and has no idea what it is about.  If you can get past her, then the job is yours, otherwise not.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with diversity?

title: Assistant to the Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took too long. The question were already decided and nothing more than that was asked. The HR person was not very quick with responding to emails or voice messages. The panel did not ask counter questions. They were just following the script of questions.
Interview Questions: Give us an example when you had to deal with a tough person/stakeholder and how did you manage the situation.

title: Internet Infrastructure Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Centennial College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
it last for more than 3 weeks from submitting resume to get offer, and I have 3 interviews with their hr, depart and manager.
It is pretty easy to deal with the question, but you can not identify their decision on-site. YYou have to wait for their decision by phone call.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your impression of Centennial College?
